description: Escalation factors that worsen marine environmental problems in bowtie analysis

escalation_factors.name: Extreme weather events
escalation_factors.description: Hurricanes, storms, and extreme precipitation
escalation_factors.mechanism: Increases transport of pollutants, physical damage, and stress on ecosystems

escalation_factors.name: Sea level rise
escalation_factors.description: Long-term increase in ocean levels
escalation_factors.mechanism: Increases coastal erosion, saltwater intrusion, and habitat loss

escalation_factors.name: El Ni単o / La Ni単a events
escalation_factors.description: Periodic climate oscillations affecting ocean conditions
escalation_factors.mechanism: Alters temperature, currents, and productivity

escalation_factors.name: Marine heatwaves
escalation_factors.description: Prolonged periods of anomalously warm water
escalation_factors.mechanism: Causes coral bleaching, species mortality, and distribution shifts

escalation_factors.name: Economic downturns
escalation_factors.description: Recession or financial crisis reducing resources for conservation
escalation_factors.mechanism: Reduces funding for environmental protection and enforcement

escalation_factors.name: Political instability or conflict
escalation_factors.description: War, civil unrest, or governance failures
escalation_factors.mechanism: Weakens enforcement, increases illegal activities, disrupts management

escalation_factors.name: Population growth in coastal zones
escalation_factors.description: Increasing human populations along coasts
escalation_factors.mechanism: Increases all anthropogenic pressures and resource demand

escalation_factors.name: Weak enforcement of regulations
escalation_factors.description: Inadequate monitoring and punishment of violations
escalation_factors.mechanism: Reduces effectiveness of all regulatory controls

escalation_factors.name: Technological failures
escalation_factors.description: Breakdown of pollution control or safety equipment
escalation_factors.mechanism: Leads to uncontrolled releases and accidents

escalation_factors.name: Multiple stressor interactions
escalation_factors.description: Combined effects greater than sum of individual stressors
escalation_factors.mechanism: Synergistic and cumulative impacts amplify damage

escalation_factors.name: Illegal, unreported, unregulated (IUU) fishing
escalation_factors.description: Fishing activities outside regulations
escalation_factors.mechanism: Undermines fisheries management and stock recovery

escalation_factors.name: Lack of international cooperation
escalation_factors.description: Failure to coordinate across national boundaries
escalation_factors.mechanism: Prevents management of transboundary issues and shared stocks

escalation_factors.name: Habitat fragmentation
escalation_factors.description: Breaking up of continuous habitats
escalation_factors.mechanism: Reduces connectivity, gene flow, and ecosystem resilience

escalation_factors.name: Reduced ecosystem resilience
escalation_factors.description: Diminished capacity to absorb disturbances
escalation_factors.mechanism: Previous degradation makes ecosystems more vulnerable

escalation_factors.name: Drought conditions
escalation_factors.description: Prolonged periods of low precipitation
escalation_factors.mechanism: Concentrates pollutants, reduces dilution, alters salinity

escalation_factors.name: Increased shipping traffic
escalation_factors.description: Growth in maritime trade and vessel movements
escalation_factors.mechanism: Amplifies noise, collision risk, and pollution sources

escalation_factors.name: Disease outbreaks in wildlife
escalation_factors.description: Epidemics affecting marine populations
escalation_factors.mechanism: Compounds stress and mortality in degraded ecosystems

escalation_factors.name: Market demand for marine resources
escalation_factors.description: High prices driving overexploitation
escalation_factors.mechanism: Incentivizes increased extraction regardless of sustainability

escalation_factors.name: Inadequate scientific understanding
escalation_factors.description: Lack of data on ecosystem functioning and threats
escalation_factors.mechanism: Prevents effective management and control measures

escalation_factors.name: Public awareness and engagement deficits
escalation_factors.description: Lack of understanding and concern about marine issues
escalation_factors.mechanism: Reduces political will and behavioral change
